Job Title: Final Area Audit

Location: Mentor, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Company Overview

COME JOIN OUR JOURNEY!

When you join TT, you join our global community of visionaries, creators, and achievers dedicated to solving technology challenges for a sustainable world. Simply put, we are a global manufacturer with a passion for engineering advanced electronics that benefit our planet and people for future generations. We are committed to having a positive impact on the world through a culture built around safety, transparency, collaboration, and positive relationships. Our teams are fueled by performance and expertise, leading the charge in innovation, efficiency and delivering world-class customer service. Be part of the journey.

Role Overview And Responsibilities

Role Overview and Responsibilities

1 st Shift Monday-Thursday 5:00-3:30pm

As a Final Area Auditor, you are responsible for the inspection of printed circuit boards, electronic materials and assemblies for conformance. You must be able to use a microscope, magnifying glass and pay attention to detail.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

 Ability to routinely inspect large quantities of electronic circuit boards to identify solder defects.  Identify non-conforming material (NCM) and properly segregate.  Follow proper techniques to ensure component reliability and to avoid damage.  Follow procedures, inspections, and in-process audits.  Understands computer operations for accessing manufacturing instructions, printing labels and any other functions required.  Proficient in determining accept/reject criteria based on IPC-A-610 .  Follow ITAR regulations. 

Qualifications, Skills, Attributes

 Qualifications, Skills and Attributes 

The Team member is required to have close visual acuity to perform inspections; including visual inspection, using measurement devices; and/or assembly of parts at distances close to the eyes. Ability or increased ability to see color, or perceive color differences, under normal lighting conditions.

Physical Demands: The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by Team Member to successfully perform of the essential functions of this job.

Constantly grasp, hear, and do repetitive motions 90-100% of the time; frequently reach, 60-90% of the time; Occasionally stoop, stand, push, pull, lift, 30-60%

Work Environment: The Team member is subject to inside environmental conditions: Protection from weather conditions but not room temperature changes, there is sufficient noise to cause the worker to increase volume in order to be heard above ambient noise level. The Team Member is constantly exposed to high heat and chemicals and is required to safety glasses (90-100%).

Team members are required to work overtime on as as needed basis.

Solving Technology Challenges for a Sustainable World

We want the very best people in our TT family across the globe – so we welcome applications from everyone, to celebrate a diverse mix of experiences, backgrounds and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all and you can rest assured that TT Electronics takes positive steps to ensure we are an inclusive business, that will welcome and support you, from your initial application to wherever your career takes you! Please get in touch if you’d like to discuss any reasonable adjustments to your application, in order that we can accommodate and support you in the process. If you want to work for a company where who you are is valued and respected, we’d love to hear from you.

#WeAreTT #BeMeAtTT

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
